shortdesc.ph: Adjusts the playback volume of all remote users' signal locally.
Adjusts the signal volume of all remote users for local playback.
Adjusts the signal volume of all remote users for local playback.
Adjusts the playback volume of all remote users locally.

section.p: This method adjusts the signal volume of all remote users after mixing and playing back locally. If you want to adjust the signal volume of a specific remote user locally, we recommend calling .

This method adjusts the signal volume of all remote users after mixing for local playback. If you need to adjust the signal volume of a specific remote user for local playback, it is recommended to call .

This method adjusts the signal volume of all remote users after mixing for local playback. If you need to adjust the signal volume of a specific remote user for local playback, it is recommended to call .
This method adjusts the signal volume of all remote users after mixing, as played locally. If you want to adjust the volume of a specific remote user locally, you are advised to call .

section.title: Timing
section.p: Can be called before or after joining a channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel.

plentry.pd:
Volume, range is [0,400].
0: Mute.
100: (Default) Original volume.
400: 4 times the original volume, with overflow protection.

Volume, range is [0,400].
0: Mute.
100: (Default) Original volume.
400: 4 times the original volume, with built-in overflow protection.

Volume, range is [0,400].
0: Mute.
100: (Default) Original volume.
400: 4 times the original volume, with built-in overflow protection.

Volume, range is [0,400].
0: Mute.
100: (Default) Original volume.
400: 4 times the original volume, with built-in overflow protection.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
